Package org.neo4j.kernel.impl.storemigration

Class StoreUpgrader

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.neo4j.kernel.impl.storemigration.StoreUpgrader
  • public class StoreUpgrader
extends Object
    A migration process to migrate migration participants, if there's need for it, before the database fully starts. Participants can register and will be notified when it's time for migration. The migration will happen to a separate, isolated directory so that an incomplete migration will not affect the original database. Only when a successful migration has taken place the migrated store will replace the original database.

    Migration process at a glance:

    1. Participants are asked whether or not there's a need for migration
    2. Those that need are asked to migrate into a separate /upgrade directory. Regardless of who actually performs migration all participants are asked to satisfy dependencies for downstream participants
    3. Migration is marked as migrated
    4. Participants are asked to move their migrated files into the source directory, replacing only the existing files, so that if only some store files needed migration the others are left intact
    5. Migration is completed and participant resources are closed

    See Also:
    StoreMigrationParticipant

      • addParticipant

        public void addParticipant​(StoreMigrationParticipant participant)
        Add migration participant into a participants list. Participant will be added into the end of a list and will be executed only after all predecessors.
        Parameters:
        participant - - participant to add into migration

      • migrateIfNeeded

        public void migrateIfNeeded​(DatabaseLayout layout,
                            boolean forceUpgrade)
                     throws IOException
        Upgrade the store format, if it is not the latest version or is different from the configured desired format.
        Parameters:
        layout - The layout of the existing database store.
        forceUpgrade - If true, the value of the GraphDatabaseSettings.allow_upgrade setting is ignored.
        Throws:
        IOException
